Er, sorry if this is covered but I read back a half dozen pages and my search got me nowhere.

On reading the blog entry mentioned, it says that the lag is caused by the plugin trying to run all of the satellites at once? I played a game through in 0.21 visiting about half the planets for mapping and after a while it got silly and was removed with much wailing and nashing of teeth and a restart. I miss it, it is completely necessary.

Does this mean that if you only had one mapping satellite in your game world at any time, then the lag could be mostly disposed of or am I just being really really hopeful? I would test myself but I can't face investing that much time only to start again again again again or whatever savegame I'm on now, I'm hoping that someone has tried this strategy?

Does this currently work for .22 or do we need a update?

Does this currently work for .22 or do we need a update?

It works as well as it ever did.

If you want to use it in career mode, you'll need to edit the part configs and add a "TechRequired" line, or use ModuleManager to add the appropriate variables to the parts:


@PART[ISA_MapSat]:Final
{
	TechRequired = scienceTech
}
@PART[ISA_GPS]:Final
{
	TechRequired = scienceTech
}

The author has been inactive for an extended period, and I doubt will ever come back. It's not my place to judge a man, but reserving all rights to himself then leaving the project unmaintained does not look good in the eyes of the community. Especially because this is the best, and as far as I know, the only plugin of its kind. I also doubt there will be an alternative anytime soon.

Fortunately, as Gaius said, it's working in 0.22, but it's only a matter of time until Squad changes something in the code that breaks the plugin.
